cards.name: Deoxys ex

ability.name: Form Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys ex and switch it with Deoxys ex. (Any cards attached to Deoxys ex, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys ex on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Burst
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Deoxys ex. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Geomancy
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fairy Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rainbow Spear
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Windstorm
text: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Turtwig.

attacks.name: Parboil
attacks.text: If you have Chimchar in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Anger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

cards.name: Hariyama ex

ability.name: Commanding Aura
ability.text: As long as Hariyama ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hariyama ex by attacks is increased by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Terraforming
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 5 cards from your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Aggron is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Mat Block
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

ability.name: Magnetic Field
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magnetic Force
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

cards.name: Rayquaza ex

ability.name: Dragon Boost
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you put Rayquaza ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to Rayquaza ex.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage for each basic Energy card attached to Rayquaza ex.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Pineco does 50 damage to itself.

ability.name: Synergy Effect
ability.text: If Glacia's Stadium is in play, any damage done to Glalie by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Glalie does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Power Heater
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to each of those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Salamence ex

ability.name: Dragon Lift
ability.text: The Retreat Cost for each of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Baby Pokémon) is 0.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flame Jet
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Salamence ex.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards discarded in this way.

cards.name: Captivating Poké Puff
text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench.

cards.name: Challenge!
text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lairon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Potion Energy
text: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any. Potion Energy provides energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

ability.name: Dark Palm
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, you may choose 1 of them and shuffle that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dusknoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hard Feelings
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. Then, count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken and put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Intense Voltage
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Elekid is anywhere under Electivire, you may move a Lightning Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: You may discard all  Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

attacks.name: Meteor Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Infernape.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Delcatty ex

ability.name: Constrain
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each player discards cards until that player has 6 cards in his or her hand. (You discard first.) This power can't be used if Delcatty ex is affected by a Special Condition.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Upstream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Energy cards. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards you find there. Show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Celebi Star

ability.name: Time Travel
ability.text: If Celebi Star would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may flip a coin. If heads, Celebi Star is not Knocked Out, discard all cards attached to Celebi Star, and put Celebi Star on the bottom of your deck.

text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Leaf Shade
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to Celebi Star. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Clear Body
ability.text: Metang can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Extra Comet Punch does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Floral Scent
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Mirage Stadium
text: Whenever a player tries to Retreat a Pokémon during his or her turn, that player flips a coin. If heads, that player retreats that Pokémon (and discards Energy normally). If tails, that Pokémon can't Retreat this turn (the player doesn't discard any Energy).

cards.name: Chesnaught-EX
text: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

ability.name: Sharp Eye
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Luxray from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent's Bench isn't full, choose 1 Basic Pokémon from your opponent's hand, and put it onto his or her Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Star
attacks.text: Move all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Crushing Hammer
text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Surprise Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, flip another coin. If the second coin is heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If the second coin is tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pokémon Catcher
text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spit Squall
attacks.text: Your opponent puts the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her hand.

ability.name: Magnetize
ability.text: If you have any Metal Energy attached to your Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for that Pokémon is 0.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to Magnezone.

cards.name: Energy Recycler
text: Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Forest of Giant Plants
text: Each player's Grass Pokémon can evolve during his or her first turn or the turn he or she plays those Pokémon.

cards.name: Level Ball
text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch Manaphy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heavy Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Everyone Explode Now
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Pineco and Forretress you have in play. This attack does 30 damage to each of your Pineco and Forretress in play.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Discard 2 Psychic Energy attached to Deoxys and remove 6 damage counters from Deoxys.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

attacks.name: Solar Suggestion
attacks.text: Move up to 4 damage counters from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Transback
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

ability.name: Strikes Back
ability.text: If Vigoroth is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Vigoroth is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Inviting Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move any number of Grass Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Delphox-EX
text: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wonder Flare
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. This attack does 40 more damage for each Energy card in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Super Energy Removal
text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those energy cards.

attacks.name: Volcano Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck. If tails, discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

ability.name: Earth Fissure
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Rhyperior from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Rhyperior can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Greninja-EX
text: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ninja Fang
attacks.text: If, before Gliscor does damage, the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it and is then damaged by this attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Splash
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Darkness Pokémon in play."

cards.name: Maintenance
text: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

cards.name: PlusPower
text: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémonn. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blessed Wings
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from each of your Pokémon. Shuffle Togekiss and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Super Potion
text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spike Whip
attacks.text: If Budew is anywhere under Roserade, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Poké Ball
text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mystic Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Psychic Energy in play.

attacks.name: Splashing Dodge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
